jparsec.graph.chartRendering

Class RenderSatellite

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.chartRendering.RenderSatellite

  • public class RenderSatellite
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for satellite rendering.

    The satellite are rendered with their subEarth positions projected in a cylindrical view of the Earth. Sun and Moon are also shown using image icons.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

      Fields

      static boolean ALLOW_SPLINE_RESIZING

        Hold the geographic position of rendered bodies.

      • ALLOW_SPLINE_RESIZING

        public static boolean ALLOW_SPLINE_RESIZING
        True to allow using an spline technique (in case the instance of Graphics supports it) to resize the image in high quality mode. Default value is true, set to false for better performance.

      • getTexturePosition

        public int[] getTexturePosition(LocationElement loc)
        Obtain rectangular position on the map corresponding to certain geographical coordinates. The position is measured from the top left corner, which is supposed to be geographical coordinates lon = -PI, lat = PI * 0.5.
        Parameters:
        loc - An object with the longitude and latitude in radians.
        Returns:
        An array with (x, y) coordinates.

      • getGeographicalPosition

        public LocationElement getGeographicalPosition(float x,
                                      float y)
        Obtains the geographical position corresponding to certain map coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - X position.
        y - Y position.
        Returns:
        An object with the geographical coordinates. Distance is set to unity.

      • setSatelliteRenderElement

        public void setSatelliteRenderElement(SatelliteRenderElement render,
                             TimeElement time,
                             ObserverElement obs,
                             EphemerisElement ephIn)
                               throws JPARSECException
        Sets the satellite render objects.
        Parameters:
        render - Render object.
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        ephIn - Ephemeris object.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • addSatellite

        public boolean addSatellite(java.lang.String name)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Adds an artificial Earth satellite to render another one.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the satellite.
        Returns:
        True if it was added correctly, false otherwise (for example if the rendering date is more than 30 days far from the date of the orbital elements).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the mother body is not the Earth, or if another error occurs.

      • getSatelliteEphem

        public SatelliteEphemElement[] getSatelliteEphem()
        Returns the ephemerides for the artificial satellites.
        Returns:
        Ephemerides.

      • getMoonEphem

        public EphemElement[] getMoonEphem()

        Returns:
        The ephemerides.

      • getSunEphem

        Returns:
        Ephemerides for Sun.

        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
